Articles.Content: Hello, I've seen a post on kerbal academy showing a craft orbiting 2 m off the ground on a perfectly spherical moon with no hills or valleys. I'd like to mess around with such a planet but cannot see a mod that adds a planet that's just a ball. Anyone know how I can get this? Thank you dearly

Step 1: Download Kopernicus

Step 2: make a new cfg file with this in it: 

+Body[Mun]
{
	@name = SphereWorld
    @Template
    {
    	removeAllPQSMods = true
    }
    @Orbit
    {
    	@referenceBody = Eve
    }
}

This clones Mun, makes it perfectly spherical, and moves it to orbit Eve.

3 hours ago, Mrcarrot said:

Step 2: make a new cfg file with this in it:

with a specific name or can I name it what ever? I'm assuming any name I want

Edit: within the config folder of kopernicus I made a txt file and added your script, then I saved it as Molo.cfg making sure it isn't molo.cfg.txt. I loaded a save I use ingame and no extra moon on eve, must it be a new game? 

Edit 2: new save still doesn't work, am I meant to replace @orbit with a specific orbit?, how does it know what orbit size to create?
